meanings.definition: To expel air from the lungs suddenly with a harsh noise, often as a symptom of illness.
meanings.sent1: When you cough, it means your throat feels tickly.
meanings.sent2: I coughed a few times after inhaling some dust.
meanings.sent3: Why did the computer cough? It must have caught a virus!
meanings.sent4: The old car coughed and sputtered before finally starting.
meanings.sent5: The volcano seemed to cough up smoke and ash into the sky.

meanings.definition: A sudden expulsion of air from the lungs with a harsh noise, often as a symptom of illness.
meanings.sent1: His cough sounded really loud and rough.
meanings.sent2: She had a persistent cough that wouldn't go away.
meanings.sent3: The cough of the seal at the zoo made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: The cough of the engine signaled it needed maintenance.
meanings.sent5: The cough echoed through the quiet room, startling everyone.
